text: How can I change a huge file into csv in python
I have a huge text file (hundreds of GB) and I want to convert the file into csv file.
In my text file, I know the row delimiter is a string "<><><><><><><>".
If a line contains that string, I want to replace it with ".
Is there a way to do it without having to read the old file and rewriting a new file.
Normally I thought I need to do something like this:

code:
fin = open("input", "r")
fout = open("outpout", "w")
line = f.readline
while line != "":
   if line.contains("<><><><><><><>"):
      fout.writeline("\"")
   else:
      fout.writeline(line)
   line = f.readline

text: but copying hundreds of GB is wasteful.
Also I don't know if open will eat lots of memory (does it treat file handler as a stream?
Note: an example of the file would be
would be one row and one column in csv.
